repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**fix(api): remove invalid assertions**

Problem: `try_leave()` assertions moved in #31600 no longer hold.
Solution: Remove the assertions.

**fix(treesitter): avoid computing fold levels for empty buffer**

Problem:  Computing fold levels for an empty buffer (somehow) breaks the
          parser state, resulting in a broken highlighter and foldexpr.
          Cached foldexpr parser is invalid after filetype has changed.
Solution: Avoid computing fold levels for empty buffer.
          Clear cached foldinfos upon `FileType`.

**fix(treesitter)!: enforce buffer is loaded when creating parser**
Problem: `vim.treesitter._create_parser()` silently loads the buffer,
					bypassing the swapfile prompt.
Solution: Error for an unloaded buffer, `:edit` an unloaded buffer in
					`vim.treesitter.start()` instead.

Fix #32359

comment_data.body: Do you still believe [this](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/26192#issuecomment-1825340931) should be done @clason?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +100,9 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       return nil, err_msg
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
+    if not api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr) then
+      error(('Buffer %s must be loaded to create parser'):format(bufnr))

comment_data.body: As [before](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32233#issuecomment-2618393809), I'm still not sure _how_ this leaves our treesitter modules in a broken state. This prevents us from calling `foldexpr()` for a window into an empty buffer, which also happens to be the case while redrawing during the swapfile prompt.

Yes, although I don't have a full view of all possible situations here (which may include ones where the loading would be desired). It certainly strikes me as a better (and more consistent) default to not do this.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +100,9 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       return nil, err_msg
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
+    if not api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr) then
+      error(('Buffer %s must be loaded to create parser'):format(bufnr))

comment_data.body: Yeah I think so too. That makes us responsible for loading the buffer in the ftplugin code path. So I added an `:edit` to `vim.treesitter.start()`, ensuring the buffer is loaded during `FileType` while showing a possible swapfile prompt (in case it's called on the current buffer, as will be the case when it's called from `FileType`).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +100,9 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       return nil, err_msg
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
+    if not api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr) then
+      error(('Buffer %s must be loaded to create parser'):format(bufnr))

comment_data.body: I'd rather explicitly `bufload` rather than use the `:edit` sledgehammer...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +100,9 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       return nil, err_msg
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
+    if not api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr) then
+      error(('Buffer %s must be loaded to create parser'):format(bufnr))

comment_data.body: That would bypass the swapfile prompt.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +100,9 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       return nil, err_msg
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
+    if not api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr) then
+      error(('Buffer %s must be loaded to create parser'):format(bufnr))

comment_data.body: Hmm... I worry about other side-effects in the "happy" path then.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +100,9 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       return nil, err_msg
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
+    if not api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr) then
+      error(('Buffer %s must be loaded to create parser'):format(bufnr))

comment_data.body: I think the buffer is already loaded in the happy path, in which case the edit isn't called. It's only called when setting the filetype for an unloaded (current) buffer.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +100,9 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       return nil, err_msg
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
+    if not api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr) then
+      error(('Buffer %s must be loaded to create parser'):format(bufnr))

comment_data.body:
I've moved this check to `vim.treesitter.foldexpr()` because an empty buffer can (for some reason) still have folds which is tested by both diffmode and foldexpr tests.

I still suspect this case should actually be handled better by `languagetree.lua` but I haven't been able to figure out how.

title: fix(treesitter)!: enforce buffer is loaded when creating parser
